page.title: 14Tamar Valley _ Halton Quay
page.content: This natural quayside on the Cornish bank of the Tamar is an attraction for tourism. It provides{recreation}in the form of fishing and has the facility on its small stoney beach for launching boats. Two adjacent cottages are available for self-catering holiday accommodation. Lime kilns still stand alongside the quay, a reminder of its past industry, when lime was brought to the area by boat for use as a fertilizer for the land. The{local history}of the quay has its origin in{religion,}as it was here in the 7th century that Irish Saints Intract and Dominica landed and brought Christianity to the area. In commemoration of this there is a small chapel on the quay, where open air services are regularly held in the summer months, at the instigation of the local parish priest of St.Dominic.
